title: Ed Sheeran prepped up to host MTV award show
text:
by Paulyn Abando
October 21, 2015 Ed Sheeran
Award-winning singer Ed Sheeran may have penchant for getting inked and keeping his look a little rolled-out-of-bed, but these do not a tough guy make.
The 24-year-old singer-songwriter thinks the only time his “badass comes out (is) when I get competitive in music.”
Originally from Framlingham, Suffolk, England, Ed moved to London in 2008 in order to pursue a singing career. Three years later, he released his EP, “No. 5 Collaborations Project,” and gained the attention of musical legends Elton John and Jamie Foxx.
His first album “+” (“plus”) debuted on top of the UK album charts upon release in Sept. 2011, while his second studio album “X” (multiply) made it to number five on Billboard’s 10 Best Albums of 2014.
Clearly a talented musician with acute sense on what music listeners want, Ed has since received 46 awards and 124 nominations from several international award giving bodies.
In 2012, the English singer won the British Breakthrough Act and British Solo Male Artist award in the prestigious BRIT Awards, followed by the Best Male Solo Artist and Album of the Year award for “X” in 2015.
He also bagged the Best Male Video for “Sing” featuring Pharrell Williams at the 2014 MTV Video Music Awards, and the Favorite Male Artist and Favorite Album for “X” at the 2015 People’s Choice Awards.
Such was Ed’s popularity – which came with newfound circle of friends – his collaborations were with high-profile artists including Taylor Swift and One Direction.
“I don’t think I have much badass in my actual personality. It comes out in terms of playing a record or touring,” he humbly said in a video clip interview furnished to Bulletin Entertainment.
Ed’s concert film debut “Jumpers For Goalposts–The ‘X’ Tour” is coming to selected cinemas worldwide on Oct. 22.
On stage at the MTV EMAs
Ed will host the 2015 MTV Europe Music Awards (EMAs) alongside Australian model and former MTV Australia VJ Ruby Rose.
It is his second time to be at the EMAs and he could not be any more excited to introduce all the guest celebrities and performers on the show.
“I find it (MTV EMAs) a lot more interesting than most award shows, not necessarily American shows in general but just because it’s Europe – there’s a bit more music going on than a lot (of) press angle that’s going to make the headlines the next day. There’s just more people playing (music),” he said.
Asked if he plans to wow the Italian crowd with his hosting skills, he said with good humor, “No one’s going to watch the EMAs and be like, ‘I’m really expecting him to be a good presenter.’ Everyone’s going to watch it and know that it’s going to be an awkward two hours with me kind of fumbling lines, introducing people the wrong way, pronouncing people’s names wrong.”
But the singer is up for the challenge; he welcomes the opportunity to impress people by doing something they don’t really expect him to be good at. However, dressing to impress isn’t on his agenda.
If last year’s MTV EMA host Nicky Minaj did a lot of outfit changes, Ed will take it down a notch.
“Choose one outfit and wear it for the night,” he said. “I think I’ll change once when I perform and then change back into what I’m presenting in.”
The 2015 MTV EMAs will be held at Mediolanum Forum in Milan, Italy on Oct. 25.
2015 EMA nominee Martin Garrix and Shay Mitchell of “Pretty Little Liars” will present the awards.
Ellie Goulding, who makes her MTV EMA debut, R&B singer Jason Derulo and duo Twenty One Pilots will appear as guest performers alongside Ed, who will perform with the English drum and bass band Rudimental.
“It (Rudimental) will be their first time on the MTV EMA stage and my first time with them on TV so it will be cool,” Ed said.
